FL.content: Nazism either included “final solution” or this was an event w/in Nazism
FL.linkedContent: Nazism either included “final solution” or this was an event w/in Nazism

FL.content: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]
FL.linkedContent: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]

HERP.content: Heidegger called his belated confiding about his indulgence in Nazism: eine grosse Dummheit
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger called his belated confiding about his indulgence in Nazism: eine grosse Dummheit

HERP.content: avoid good conscience of ridicule when thinking about Nazi potential of Heidegger’s thoughts > no discourse can dissociate the scientific, the military, and labor
HERP.linkedContent: avoid good conscience of ridicule when thinking about Nazi potential of Heidegger’s thoughts > no discourse can dissociate the scientific, the military, and labor

HERP.content: difference btwn Schmitt & Heidegger: polemos is everything for both but it’s not a “human war” for Heidegger [see also pp. 211-12 can Heideggerian hearing of Kampf be distinguished from [Nazi] regime? if strategy re: decision is not formalizable—is this still not a war economy?]
HERP.linkedContent: difference btwn Schmitt & Heidegger: polemos is everything for both but it’s not a “human war” for Heidegger [see also pp. 211-12 can Heideggerian hearing of Kampf be distinguished from [Nazi] regime? if strategy re: decision is not formalizable—is this still not a war economy?]

HERP.content: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s 3 creative “Gewalten” of historial destiny: poet, thinker, statesman > their work as Schaffen carries seal or signature of originary polemos/Kampf

HERP.content: to say “Mein Kampf” would be ridiculous presumption to Heidegger [?] or does it appeal to an originary polemos?
HERP.linkedContent: to say “Mein Kampf” would be ridiculous presumption to Heidegger [?] or does it appeal to an originary polemos?

POOF.content: Schmitt claims to be writing a purely theoretical diagnostics of the political, uses “diagnostics” as alibi in Nuremberg
POOF.linkedContent: Schmitt claims to be writing a purely theoretical diagnostics of the political, uses “diagnostics” as alibi in Nuremberg

VM.content: [Derrida will not let Levinas reduce Heidegger’s interminable wandering to a new paganism of the site, it is not an empirical “nationalism”]
VM.linkedContent: [Derrida will not let Levinas reduce Heidegger’s interminable wandering to a new paganism of the site, it is not an empirical “nationalism”]

S.content: spirit’s affirmation, no quotations, spirit inflamed (and yes, I say this, because of the specters flame illuminates of terrifying moment) > Geist is flame, not pneuma or spiritus
S.linkedContent: spirit’s affirmation, no quotations, spirit inflamed (and yes, I say this, because of the specters flame illuminates of terrifying moment) > Geist is flame, not pneuma or spiritus

S.content: die Selbstbehauptung (self-affirmation) could not be what it is w/out spirit, and there is even a logic of spiritual guidance in Heidegger’s “terrifying” Rectorship Address [see pp. 34, 36-37]
S.linkedContent: die Selbstbehauptung (self-affirmation) could not be what it is w/out spirit, and there is even a logic of spiritual guidance in Heidegger’s “terrifying” Rectorship Address [see pp. 34, 36-37]

S.content: [re: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address] le profond et l’altier (haughty) allied in most high: highest of what guides the spiritual guides of die hohe Schule and depths of forces of earth and blood
S.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address] le profond et l’altier (haughty) allied in most high: highest of what guides the spiritual guides of die hohe Schule and depths of forces of earth and blood

S.content: perhaps Heidegger infused Nazism w/ spirit to absolve it? to save it?
S.linkedContent: perhaps Heidegger infused Nazism w/ spirit to absolve it? to save it?

S.content: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address is diabolical because it capitalizes on the worst, both evils at once: sanctions nazism and a metaphysical gesture [spirit w/out quotations]
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Rectorship Address is diabolical because it capitalizes on the worst, both evils at once: sanctions nazism and a metaphysical gesture [spirit w/out quotations]

S.content: what seems in service of determinate politics [nazism] in Rectorship Address, w/ spirit awakening from Vor-fragen of Führung, could be a following of the will-to-know?
S.linkedContent: what seems in service of determinate politics [nazism] in Rectorship Address, w/ spirit awakening from Vor-fragen of Führung, could be a following of the will-to-know?

S.content: Heidegger’s mediocre and hideous crossing-out of Husserl (erasing dedication of Sein und Zeit)
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s mediocre and hideous crossing-out of Husserl (erasing dedication of Sein und Zeit)

S.content: Nazism was not born in a desert but in a black European forest, world of spirit, culture (religions, philosophies, economic structures, religious/academic institutions)
S.linkedContent: Nazism was not born in a desert but in a black European forest, world of spirit, culture (religions, philosophies, economic structures, religious/academic institutions)

SH.content: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer
SH.linkedContent: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer

SH.content: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”
SH.linkedContent: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”

SH.content: Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])
SH.linkedContent: Jewish language, poetic language, this essence promises itself only in dis-identification (in the expropriation of the nothing, non-essence—[ashes?])

SH.content: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]
SH.linkedContent: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]

FWT.content: communism was perverted, Nazism was plan itself as perversion, accomplished
FWT.linkedContent: communism was perverted, Nazism was plan itself as perversion, accomplished

POS.content: Derrida mocks the doctors of scientific genealogy or ideological filiation re: Heidegger’s thought [Faye for one] > what’s lacking in the “problematic of the narrative” is reflection on what makes the theses unnarratable
POS.linkedContent: Derrida mocks the doctors of scientific genealogy or ideological filiation re: Heidegger’s thought [Faye for one] > what’s lacking in the “problematic of the narrative” is reflection on what makes the theses unnarratable

OTO.content: Nietzsche’s name has poisoned milk in it, its legacy, mixed up in advance w/ worst of our times, and not by accident
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s name has poisoned milk in it, its legacy, mixed up in advance w/ worst of our times, and not by accident

OTO.content: Derrida not going to say Nazis falsified Nietzsche’s words: they were the only ones to institute his teachings on teaching
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida not going to say Nazis falsified Nietzsche’s words: they were the only ones to institute his teachings on teaching

OTO.content: Derrida on complexity of Nietzsche’s desire for Führer and the one that Germany got
OTO.linkedContent: Derrida on complexity of Nietzsche’s desire for Führer and the one that Germany got

OTO.content: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books
OTO.linkedContent: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books

OTO.content: [re: fact that Nazis could ape Nietzsche’s text] if you refuse conscious, deliberate textual intentions, the perversion is made possible by structure of text itself (its “remaining”), otherwise it would be unreadable > nothing absolutely contingent about fact that Nazis effectively brandished his name [Derrida wary of close reading that would preserve Nietzsche’s intention]
OTO.linkedContent: [re: fact that Nazis could ape Nietzsche’s text] if you refuse conscious, deliberate textual intentions, the perversion is made possible by structure of text itself (its “remaining”), otherwise it would be unreadable > nothing absolutely contingent about fact that Nazis effectively brandished his name [Derrida wary of close reading that would preserve Nietzsche’s intention]

Gii.content: speak of Heidegger, speak of monstrosity
Heidegger condemns biological-racial ideology of Nazi party
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger condemns biological-racial ideology of Nazi party

Gii.content: Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime

REST.content: pathos of “call of the earth” of Feldweg, Holzwege, in ‘35-6, the peasant-proxy of Heidegger, not foreign to what made Goldstein march to New York
REST.linkedContent: pathos of “call of the earth” of Feldweg, Holzwege, in ‘35-6, the peasant-proxy of Heidegger, not foreign to what made Goldstein march to New York

REST.content: Derrida goes off, rather fancifully, on Heidegger’s “projection” of the peasant woman, calls the decision many names (i.e. ridiculous), then quasi-admits his story could be a projection
REST.linkedContent: Derrida goes off, rather fancifully, on Heidegger’s “projection” of the peasant woman, calls the decision many names (i.e. ridiculous), then quasi-admits his story could be a projection

REST.content: Heidegger missed the detachability of the step, the possibility of the digressive
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger missed the detachability of the step, the possibility of the digressive

REST.content: the whole “peasant” thing is accessory [re: peasant shoes]? even if part of Heidegger’s pathetic-fantasmatic-ideological-political investments

REST.content: peasant & artisanal “ideology” in painting, concern for truth in painting
REST.linkedContent: peasant & artisanal “ideology” in painting, concern for truth in painting

REST.content: Heidegger’s “projection” there in the choice of model [Van Gogh’s painting] rather than in its analysis [i.e. Van Gogh shared this ideology, and did paint peasants]
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s “projection” there in the choice of model [Van Gogh’s painting] rather than in its analysis [i.e. Van Gogh shared this ideology, and did paint peasants]

HLP.content: Derrida affirms vigilance we need against Hitler’s rejection of objective truth (valid for everyone), his privileging of myth over science [overvaluation of performative, the constative maligned]; but, this vigilance could also suspect “activist,” “pragmatist” interpretations of truth, any possibility of institutive/performative speech
HLP.linkedContent: Derrida affirms vigilance we need against Hitler’s rejection of objective truth (valid for everyone), his privileging of myth over science [overvaluation of performative, the constative maligned]; but, this vigilance could also suspect “activist,” “pragmatist” interpretations of truth, any possibility of institutive/performative speech

HLP.content: Hitler used “old Machiavellian technique”: tell truth knowing the uninitiated will not take him seriously, “conspiracy in broad daylight,” “society w/ a secret”
HLP.linkedContent: Hitler used “old Machiavellian technique”: tell truth knowing the uninitiated will not take him seriously, “conspiracy in broad daylight,” “society w/ a secret”

EW.content: Derrida, not excusing silence on Auschwitz, takes to task the sententious discourse of those who grandstand, accuse, and teach lessons w/ it—primarily to give oneself a good conscience
EW.linkedContent: Derrida, not excusing silence on Auschwitz, takes to task the sententious discourse of those who grandstand, accuse, and teach lessons w/ it—primarily to give oneself a good conscience

CF.content: Jankélévitch: forgiveness died in death camps

BSi.content: Heidegger [re: commitment to Nazism in 1933-34]: “I did a Dummheit”
[vis-à-vis Celan] January 20th [date Hitler drew up plans for ‘final solution’]—anniversary of death > sovereign decision to commit genocide
BSi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Celan] January 20th [date Hitler drew up plans for ‘final solution’]—anniversary of death > sovereign decision to commit genocide

BSi.content: Celan: are we not all descended from such dates [January 20th]?
BSi.linkedContent: Celan: are we not all descended from such dates [January 20th]?

BSi.content: Heidegger’s talk against biologism, critique of something in Nazism
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger’s talk against biologism, critique of something in Nazism

CIR.content: imbecile asks Derrida what he did to help save Jews [didn’t know Derrida was Jewish?] > maybe he was right, perhaps you didn’t do enough to save Jews, always think the other is right, at the beginning or end of the book
